text: Hi Everyone! I’m looking to use Zapier to integrate my external forms to HubSpot. Would love to have some advise and best practices. For example, do you create a form in HubSpot and have Zapier populate it with information from the external form submission, or do you only have Zapier create new contacts? I would like to create workflows like autoreply, assigning leads to reps, etc.
Do you mean access to the app marketplace and connecting apps there?

Hi !
I’d advise you to have Zapier create a form submission rather than a simple contact creation.
The advantage of this is that you can benefit from your form settings (lifecycle stage, notifications, hidden fields...) and above all from a segmentation / workflow triggering / scoring calculation point of view, it will count as a classic form submission with all the advantages that this implies.
But also, quick question : what about allowing HubSpot to collect natively External form submissions with the tracking code ?
It would be much easier as you only have one setting to activate and no Zapier needed.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms>

There isn’t but there’s plenty of things one can do to optimise a page.

• defer / async / lazy load scripts, css and images
• Setting images sizes to avoid CS
• <head> meta preloads for large image / video
• background-colors for video containers (so the element renders while fetching the video
• resize_image_url() to crop large images
• Use .webp format for images
• Compress videos
• height and width definitions for images
• setTimeout loader for external scripts where applicable (3000-5000ms)
• and other suggestions from <http://pagespeed.web.dev|pagespeed.web.dev>

Thanks! Leaning towards have Zapier create a form submission.

HubSpot’s functionality for collecting external forms has quite a few limitations, so I didn’t see that as a good option.
here link is not working

```also here video is not working     <video id="video" width="600" controls>
              <source
                src={{get_asset_url("../assets/build/videos/sample.mp4")}}
                type="video/mp4"
              />
              Your browser does not support the video tag.
            </video>```
Indeed, it’s not suitable for all cases. But when it doesn’t I use Form API - the one Zapier will use in your case. I think it’s the greatest option.
Thanks for your help :slightly_smiling_face:

Is it possible to have two sets of tags? I'd like to have a broader category, where there's maybe only 5-8, and then have additional tags that are more plentiful and granular. Is this possible? I see that there's only a way for me to enter tags.
Does anyone know of a way to add a smart rule to an email subscription preferences page ?
is that a doable thing?

Hi, all! Looking to install an ROI calculator similar to the one that HubSpot uses for its own marketing purposes. Would anyone have any recommendations  for one that can live natively on our homepage? <https://www.HubSpot.com/roi-calculator/marketing-and-sales>

I spend 100% of my time in HubSpot doing email. So I'm a bit lost when it comes to website and landing pages.

How do I create one?

In the design manager I created an HTML +HubL .html file and wrote my code. Published it. And now I want to load the finished page in my browser but I don't know how.

HEy <@U048C858Y94>, to create a landing/web page simply navigate to Content -> landing/website page and click the "create new" button in the top right.
If you've created the template in a theme(which is highly recommended) you should see a theme select option if you haven't done this already. Select your theme and your template in the next select option. Once selected you will see the page with the elements to edit(if you have used custom or default modules)
What do I do if I don't want to use a theme? I just want to use the code that I wrote.

Hi partners/dev- I am stuck in a SFdC and HubSpot back and forth with support. A client integration was working with reps seeing visual force data in lighting for months just fine, the CTO did a MS email update for security in June- the last 30 days only admin users in SFdC can see the visual force data- we have tried everything - and I think it’s a SFdC issue or an issue where the CTO needs to white list HubSpot or something now that they did that security but SFdC support is saying call HubSpot support which is no help. Any ideas? Anyone else do a ms outlook update recently that somehow this happened??happy to send a Starbucks gift card for ideas!
Thank you <@U03AKL6Q1B2>!
<@U0784GJ12UX> deal days can only be surfaced on a portal that requires login, if it's visible to the public you put the CRM at risk by exposing that data.

!
+1 for Forms API over Zapier, you'll run into errors and not always be able to resolve them.

Are you referring to blog tags <@U071YF9HQF3>?

In that case, no, you can only have one set of tags.

How you surface those tags on the blog listing page and for the articles could possibly separate them out, but it's manual and if new tags are added, code has to be updated.
Not currently possible, unless someone has created a hack - would also like to know the answer :eyes:
Hi! Would you care to elaborate? Zapier uses the Forms API when creating form submissions in HS, doesn’t it?
